title: Collaborative Action Research (CAR)-Based Curriculum for Strengthening Environmental Science Civic Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement course for pre-service or in-service teachers. Environment enabling basic search functionality via smartphones, targeting adult learners interested in community problem-solving.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze local environmental issues and propose actionable solutions by applying the IDEE Framework (Problem Identification → Solution Exploration → Ethical Review → Effectiveness Evaluation)
Learners can design and implement environmental problem-solving projects through collaborative action research (CAR) processes with peer learners and community members

Learners demonstrate environmental problem-solving competencies acquired during the learning process through concrete deliverables (e.g., recycling guidelines, energy-saving manuals) via project-based assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
